arm_group.description: Healthy inhabitants of the city of Saint-Etienne, France, and aged 65 years at the inclusion date. (NCT00759304)

brief_summary.textblock:
This study aims to evaluate skin aging of an homogeneous population of 77 years old patient
      selected among the PROOF cohort who has been continuously investigated by cardiological
      examination.

      Skin aging will be explored by macroscopic and microscopic evaluation. In particular, skin
      aging will be measured by an index of clinical aging (SCINEXA) and other complementary
      measures such as facial photos, standard and High Definition dermoscopy, elastography,
      sebumetry, in vivo and ex vivo confocal microscopy, and classical histological examinations.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Skin Parameters in the PROOF Cohort

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  included in the PROOF cohort

          -  Form consent signed

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Past history of surgery and / or treatment of aesthetic medicine

          -  neurological disorders

          -  insulin-dependent diabetes,

          -  corticosteroids or retinoids (isotretinoin, ...) > 1 year

intervention.description: Skin biopsy for examinations by confocal microscopy  ex vivo and histopathology
Examination by confocal microscopy in vivo

clinical_study.official_title: Study of Skin Parameters in the PROOF Cohort

authority: France: Agence Nationale de Sécurité du Médicament et des produits de santé

primary_outcome.description: The aging of the skin is evaluated by a semi-quantitative composite of 19 clinical variables : the score SCINEXA

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Skin aging evaluated by in vivo confocal microscopy
Skin aging evaluated by ex vivo confocal microscopy ( thickness of the epidermis with and without the stratum corneum, dermis thickness , number of sweat glands per unit volume).
Skin aging evaluated by conventional histology (thickness of the epidermis and dermis, presence and degree of elastosis , flattening of the dermo- epidermal junction)
The composition of subcutaneous fat measured by ex vivo RAMAN spectroscopy

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
